means: 许可进入( admit的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Officials hoped admitting fewer foreigners would calm the situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 官员们希望通过减少外国人入境的数量来使局势平定下来。

sentence.Network_en: He showed great courage by admitting that he is an alcoholic.
sentence.Network_cn: 他以极大的勇气承认自己酗酒。

sentence.Network_en: Many people felt that admitting to stress was a sign of weakness.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多人认为承认有压力是意志薄弱的表现。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《张博士英语单词定位... ... considering conj. 就…而论； 照…来看；考虑到… admitting conj. 即使，虽说 granting conj. 即使，就算.

he is humble in admitting his own mistakes when his attention is directed to them in a friendly way , but even in his fifties he would have none of the foolishness which hurts his pride .当他们友好地指出他的错误时，他会谦逊地承认。然而，即使是他年过半百，也不能容忍伤害他尊严的蠢事。
admitting the coastguard was heavy-handed , it promised to ensure that legal compensation ran smoothly .他们承认海事警务厅的船的失误，承诺保证依法适量赔偿，并平稳地处理赔偿事宜。
admitting 导入, admitting 收容, admitting 接纳

list.abs: 诉讼法律英语词汇(1)_酷悠中英文对照双语阅读网 ... 裁决书 award 采信的证据 admitted evidence 查封 seal up.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... admire to do sth. (美口)很想做某事 admit of 容许有，有…余地 admit to 承认.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... admire to do sth. (美口)很想做某事 admit of 容许有，有…余地 admit to 承认.
hold sth to account 与....对证，核实admit to 许可，允许appear to 似乎，好像.
绿光森林经典台词... ... 抱歉（ sorry） 我承认（ I admit） 但是我无法停止想念她（ but I can’t stop thinking about her）.

entry.def: If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.

example.ex: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes...
example.tran: 我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

example.ex: Up to two thirds of 14 to 16 year olds admit to buying drink illegally...
example.tran: 14到16岁的青少年中多达2/3的人承认非法买过酒。

entry.def: If someone is admitted to hospital, they are taken into hospital for treatment and kept there until they are well enough to go home.

example.ex: She was admitted to hospital with a soaring temperature...
example.tran: 她因发高烧被送进医院。

example.ex: He was admitted yesterday for treatment of blood clots in his lungs.
example.tran: 他昨天入院治疗肺部的血块。

entry.def: If someone is admitted to an organization or group, they are allowed to join it.

example.ex: He was admitted to the Academie Culinaire de France...
example.tran: 他获准加入法兰西厨艺学会。

example.ex: The Parachute Regiment could be forced to admit women.
example.tran: 伞兵团可能会被迫招收女性。

entry.def: To admit someone to a place means to allow them to enter it.

example.ex: Embassy security personnel refused to admit him or his wife...
example.tran: 使馆保安人员不允许他和夫人进入。

example.ex: Journalists are rarely admitted to the region.
example.tran: 新闻记者很少获准进入该地区。
